title: The Week of Sue Richardson: Teacher of Light
summary: Sue Richardson, a 66-year-old retired teacher with a deep faith, discovers her ability to inspire and heal her community through prayer and wisdom, facing various challenges and ultimately bringing peace to her neighborhood.
summaryGerman: Sue Richardson, eine 66-jährige pensionierte Lehrerin mit tiefem Glauben, entdeckt ihre Fähigkeit, ihre Gemeinde durch Gebet und Weisheit zu inspirieren und zu heilen, stellt sich verschiedenen Herausforderungen und bringt letztendlich Frieden in ihre Nachbarschaft.
summaryDutch: Sue Richardson, een 66-jarige gepensioneerde lerares met een diep geloof, ontdekt haar vermogen om haar gemeenschap te inspireren en te genezen door gebed en wijsheid, geconfronteerd met verschillende uitdagingen en uiteindelijk vrede brengend in haar buurt.
summaryFrench: Sue Richardson, une enseignante retraitée de 66 ans avec une foi profonde, découvre sa capacité à inspirer et à guérir sa communauté par la prière et la sagesse, fait face à divers défis et apporte finalement la paix dans son quartier.

story.text: Sue discovers a strange glow around her hands during her morning prayer. Curious and slightly alarmed, she decides to observe if it happens again.

The glowing returns stronger. In her former classroom, Sue tries comforting a troubled former student with her warm, radiant hands. The student leaves feeling unusually peaceful, sparking hope in Sue.
Sue spends the day visiting sick community members. She prays and lays hands on them, noticing visible improvements in their conditions. Word begins to spread of her gifts.
Skeptics question the source of Sue's abilities. She feels disheartened but continues her work, focusing on a local homeless shelter.
A small group of supporters gathers to defend Sue’s intentions. They organize a community prayer group, inviting Sue to lead. The event is filled with powerful moments of unity and gratitude.
Rumors of a supervillain in town reach Sue. While praying for guidance, she devises a plan to confront this threat with her new-found powers and wisdom.
Sue faces the so-called 'villain', only to find a deeply hurt individual. She talks to him, prays with him, and guides him towards seeking help. The town heralds her as a hero.

ending: Thus, in the span of a week, Sue Richardson transitioned from a simple teacher to the guardian angel of her community.
moral: Even in retirement, one's ability to contribute to the well-being of others and make a significant difference should never be underestimated.
